checklistItems.title: Create a Culture of Financial Responsibility
checklistItems.description: Train personnel regularly, foster spending accountability, invest in tooling and automation

checklistItems.title: Create and Maintain a Cost Model
checklistItems.description: Estimate initial and ongoing costs, negotiate budget with buffer for unplanned spending

checklistItems.title: Collect and Review Cost Data
checklistItems.description: Capture daily costs, include metered, prepaid, trends, and forecasts, automate alerts for spending thresholds

checklistItems.title: Set Spending Guardrails
checklistItems.description: Implement release gates, create governance policies, set resource limits and access controls, prioritize platform automation

checklistItems.title: Get Best Rates from Providers
checklistItems.description: Review regional pricing, examine pricing tiers and models, consider license portability, review corporate purchasing plans

checklistItems.title: Align Usage to Billing Increments
checklistItems.description: Understand billing meters, modify services or resource usage to align with increments, use proof-of-concept to validate billing knowledge

checklistItems.title: Optimize Component Costs
checklistItems.description: Regularly remove or optimize legacy/underutilized components, review application and platform features

checklistItems.title: Optimize Environment Costs
checklistItems.description: Align spending across environments, consider availability, licensing, operating conditions, emulate production in nonproduction environments

checklistItems.title: Optimize Flow Costs
checklistItems.description: Align cost with flow priority, consider features, functionality, requirements, make strategic compromises

checklistItems.title: Optimize Data Costs
checklistItems.description: Prioritize data spending, improve data management, optimize tiering, retention, volume, replication

checklistItems.title: Optimize Code Costs
checklistItems.description: Evaluate code to meet requirements, reduce resource consumption

checklistItems.title: Optimize Scaling Costs
checklistItems.description: Evaluate scaling configurations, align with cost model, consider resource utilization and limits

checklistItems.title: Optimize Personnel Time
checklistItems.description: Align time spent with task priority, reduce task time without degrading outcomes, minimize noise, reduce build times

checklistItems.title: Consolidate Resources
checklistItems.description: Consolidate internal resources, use centralized services, increase resource density

assessmentPrompt:
You are conducting a Cost Optimization assessment following the official Microsoft Well-Architected Framework methodology.

OFFICIAL COST OPTIMIZATION CHECKLIST (14 items):
1. CO:01 - Create a Culture of Financial Responsibility: Train personnel regularly, foster spending accountability, invest in tooling and automation
2. CO:02 - Create and Maintain a Cost Model: Estimate initial and ongoing costs, negotiate budget with buffer for unplanned spending
3. CO:03 - Collect and Review Cost Data: Capture daily costs, include metered, prepaid, trends, and forecasts, automate alerts for spending thresholds
4. CO:04 - Set Spending Guardrails: Implement release gates, create governance policies, set resource limits and access controls, prioritize platform automation
5. CO:05 - Get Best Rates from Providers: Review regional pricing, examine pricing tiers and models, consider license portability, review corporate purchasing plans
6. CO:06 - Align Usage to Billing Increments: Understand billing meters, modify services or resource usage to align with increments, use proof-of-concept to validate billing knowledge
7. CO:07 - Optimize Component Costs: Regularly remove or optimize legacy/underutilized components, review application and platform features
8. CO:08 - Optimize Environment Costs: Align spending across environments, consider availability, licensing, operating conditions, emulate production in nonproduction environments
9. CO:09 - Optimize Flow Costs: Align cost with flow priority, consider features, functionality, requirements, make strategic compromises
10. CO:10 - Optimize Data Costs: Prioritize data spending, improve data management, optimize tiering, retention, volume, replication
11. CO:11 - Optimize Code Costs: Evaluate code to meet requirements, reduce resource consumption
12. CO:12 - Optimize Scaling Costs: Evaluate scaling configurations, align with cost model, consider resource utilization and limits
13. CO:13 - Optimize Personnel Time: Align time spent with task priority, reduce task time without degrading outcomes, minimize noise, reduce build times
14. CO:14 - Consolidate Resources: Consolidate internal resources, use centralized services, increase resource density

ASSESSMENT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Evaluate the architecture against each checklist item
- Provide specific recommendations using Azure services
- Score each area on a 1-10 scale with detailed justification
- Focus on compliance gaps and improvement opportunities
- Reference official WAF guidance in your analysis

Follow the official Microsoft WAF Cost Optimization methodology for consistent, professional assessment.
